member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode
member.summary: Specifies how different clipping regions can be combined.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Replace
member.summary: One clipping region is replaced by another.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Union
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Xor
member.summary: Two clipping regions are combined by taking only the areas enclosed by one or the other region, but not both.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: Specifies that the existing region is replaced by the result of the new region being removed from the existing region. Said differently, the new region is excluded from the existing region.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CombineMode.Complement
member.summary: Specifies that the existing region is replaced by the result of the existing region being removed from the new region. Said differently, the existing region is excluded from the new region.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CompositingMode
member.summary: Specifies how the source colors are combined with the background colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CompositingMode.SourceOver
member.summary: Specifies that when a color is rendered, it is blended with the background color. The blend is determined by the alpha component of the color being rendered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CompositingMode.SourceCopy
member.summary: Specifies that when a color is rendered, it overwrites the background color.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CoordinateSpace
member.summary: Specifies the system to use when evaluating coordinates.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CoordinateSpace.World
member.summary: Specifies that coordinates are in the world coordinate context. World coordinates are used in a nonphysical environment, such as a modeling environment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CoordinateSpace.Page
member.summary: Specifies that coordinates are in the page coordinate context. Their units are defined by the Graphics.PageUnit property, and must be one of the elements of the GraphicsUnit enumeration.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.CoordinateSpace.Device
member.summary: Specifies that coordinates are in the device coordinate context. On a computer screen the device coordinates are usually measured in pixels.

member.summary: Appends the specified GraphicsPath to this path.

A Boolean value that specifies whether the first figure in the added path is part of the last figure in this path. member.summary: The InterpolationMode enumeration specifies the algorithm that is used when images are scaled or rotated.

member.summary: Specifies low quality interpolation.

member.summary: Specifies high quality interpolation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode.Bilinear
member.summary: Specifies bilinear interpolation. No prefiltering is done. This mode is not suitable for shrinking an image below 50 percent of its original size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode.Bicubic
member.summary: Specifies bicubic interpolation. No prefiltering is done. This mode is not suitable for shrinking an image below 25 percent of its original size.

member.summary: Specifies nearest-neighbor interpolation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode.HighQualityBilinear
member.summary: Specifies high-quality, bilinear interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Drawing2D.InterpolationMode.HighQualityBicubic
member.summary: Specifies high-quality, bicubic interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking. This mode produces the highest quality transformed images.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType
member.summary: Specifies the nature of the records that are placed in an Enhanced Metafile (EMF) file. This enumeration is used by several constructors in the class.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType.EmfOnly
member.summary: Specifies that all the records in the metafile are EMF records, which can be displayed by GDI or GDI+.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType.EmfPlusOnly
member.summary: Specifies that all the records in the metafile are EMF+ records, which can be displayed by GDI+ but not by GDI.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType.EmfPlusDual
member.summary: Specifies that all EMF+ records in the metafile are associated with an alternate EMF record. Metafiles of type can be displayed by GDI or by GDI+.

A byte that specifies the value stored in the object.
If true, the property is set to ; otherwise, the property is set to .

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and one 64-bit integer. Sets the property to (32 bits), and sets the property to 1.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
A 64-bit integer that specifies the value stored in the object. Must be nonnegative. This parameter is converted to a 32-bit integer before it is stored in the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and a pair of 32-bit integers. The pair of integers represents a fraction, the first integer being the numerator, and the second integer being the denominator. Sets the property to , and sets the property to 1.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
A 32-bit integer that represents the numerator of a fraction. Must be nonnegative.
A 32-bit integer that represents the denominator of a fraction. Must be nonnegative.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and a pair of 64-bit integers. The pair of integers represents a range of integers, the first integer being the smallest number in the range, and the second integer being the largest number in the range. Sets the property to , and sets the property to 1.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
A 64-bit integer that represents the smallest number in a range of integers. Must be nonnegative. This parameter is converted to a 32-bit integer before it is stored in the object.
A 64-bit integer that represents the largest number in a range of integers. Must be nonnegative. This parameter is converted to a 32-bit integer before it is stored in the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and four, 32-bit integers. The four integers represent a range of fractions. The first two integers represent the smallest fraction in the range, and the remaining two integers represent the largest fraction in the range. Sets the property to , and sets the property to 1.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
A 32-bit integer that represents the numerator of the smallest fraction in the range. Must be nonnegative.
A 32-bit integer that represents the denominator of the smallest fraction in the range. Must be nonnegative.
A 32-bit integer that represents the numerator of the largest fraction in the range. Must be nonnegative.
A 32-bit integer that represents the denominator of the largest fraction in the range. Must be nonnegative.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and a character string. The string is converted to a null-terminated ASCII string before it is stored in the object. member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
A that specifies the value stored in the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int64[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and an array of 64-bit integers. Sets the property to (32-bit), and sets the property to the number of elements in the array.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.

An array of 64-bit integers that specifies the values stored in the object. The integers in the array must be nonnegative. The 64-bit integers are converted to 32-bit integers before they are stored in the object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and two arrays of 32-bit integers. The two arrays represent an array of fractions. Sets the property to , and sets the property to the number of elements in the array, which must be the same as the number of elements in the array.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the numerators of the fractions. The integers in the array must be nonnegative.

An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the denominators of the fractions. The integers in the array must be nonnegative. A denominator of a given index is paired with the numerator of the same index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int64[],System.Int64[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and two arrays of 64-bit integers. The two arrays represent an array integer ranges. Sets the property to , and sets the property to the number of elements in the array, which must be the same as the number of elements in the array.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.

An array of 64-bit integers that specifies the minimum values for the integer ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative. The 64-bit integers are converted to 32-bit integers before they are stored in the object.

An array of 64-bit integers that specifies the maximum values for the integer ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative. The 64-bit integers are converted to 32-bit integers before they are stored in the object. A maximum value of a given index is paired with the minimum value of the same index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderParameter.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.Encoder,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and four arrays of 32-bit integers. The four arrays represent an array rational ranges. A rational range is the set of all fractions from a minimum fractional value through a maximum fractional value. Sets the property to , and sets the property to the number of elements in the array, which must be the same as the number of elements in the other three arrays.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the numerators of the minimum values for the ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative.
An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the denominators of the minimum values for the ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative.
An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the numerators of the maximum values for the ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative.
An array of 32-bit integers that specifies the denominators of the maximum values for the ranges. The integers in the array must be nonnegative.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified object and three integers that specify the number of values, the data type of the values, and a pointer to the values stored in the object.
member.param: An object that encapsulates the globally unique identifier of the parameter category.
An integer that specifies the number of values stored in the object. The property is set to this value.
A member of the enumeration that specifies the data type of the values stored in the object. The and properties are set to this value.
A pointer to an array of values of the type specified by the parameter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue
member.summary: Used to specify the parameter value passed to a JPEG or TIFF image encoder when using the or methods.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.ColorTypeCMYK
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.ColorTypeYCCK
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.CompressionLZW
member.summary: Specifies the LZW compression scheme. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the Compression category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT3
member.summary: Specifies the CCITT3 compression scheme. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the compression category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.CompressionCCITT4
member.summary: Specifies the CCITT4 compression scheme. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the compression category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.CompressionRle
member.summary: Specifies the RLE compression scheme. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the compression category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.CompressionNone
member.summary: Specifies no compression. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the compression category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.ScanMethodInterlaced
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.ScanMethodNonInterlaced
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.VersionGif87
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.VersionGif89
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.RenderProgressive
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.RenderNonProgressive
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.TransformRotate90
member.summary: Specifies that the image is to be rotated clockwise 90 degrees about its center. Can be passed to the JPEG encoder as a parameter that belongs to the transformation category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.TransformRotate180
member.summary: Specifies that the image is to be rotated 180 degrees about its center. Can be passed to the JPEG encoder as a parameter that belongs to the transformation category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.TransformRotate270
member.summary: Specifies that the image is to be rotated clockwise 270 degrees about its center. Can be passed to the JPEG encoder as a parameter that belongs to the transformation category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.TransformFlipHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies that the image is to be flipped horizontally (about the vertical axis). Can be passed to the JPEG encoder as a parameter that belongs to the transformation category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.TransformFlipVertical
member.summary: Specifies that the image is to be flipped vertically (about the horizontal axis). Can be passed to the JPEG encoder as a parameter that belongs to the transformation category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.MultiFrame
member.summary: Specifies that the image has more than one frame (page). Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the save flag category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.LastFrame
member.summary: Specifies the last frame in a multiple-frame image. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the save flag category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.Flush
member.summary: Specifies that a multiple-frame file or stream should be closed. Can be passed to the TIFF encoder as a parameter that belongs to the save flag category.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.FrameDimensionTime
member.summary: Not used in GDI+ version 1.0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.EncoderValue.FrameDimensionResolution

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType
member.summary: Specifies types of metafiles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies a metafile format that is not recognized in GDI+.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.Wmf
member.summary: Specifies a WMF (Windows Metafile) file. Such a file contains only GDI records.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.WmfPlaceable
member.summary: Specifies a WMF (Windows Metafile) file that has a placeable metafile header in front of it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.Emf
member.summary: Specifies an Enhanced Metafile (EMF) file. Such a file contains only GDI records.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.EmfPlusOnly
member.summary: Specifies an EMF+ file. Such a file contains only GDI+ records and must be displayed by using GDI+. Displaying the records using GDI may cause unpredictable results.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.MetafileType.EmfPlusDual
member.summary: Specifies an EMF+ Dual file. Such a file contains GDI+ records along with alternative GDI records and can be displayed by using either GDI or GDI+. Displaying the records using GDI may cause some quality degradation.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the color data for each pixel in the image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Indexed
member.summary: The pixel data contains color-indexed values, which means the values are an index to colors in the system color table, as opposed to individual color values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi
member.summary: The pixel data contains GDI colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Alpha
member.summary: The pixel data contains alpha values that are not premultiplied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.PAlpha
member.summary: The pixel format contains premultiplied alpha values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Extended
member.summary: Reserved value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Canonical
member.summary: The default pixel format of 32 bits per pixel. The format specifies 24-bit color depth and an 8-bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Undefined
member.summary: The pixel format is undefined.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.DontCare
member.summary: No pixel format is specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format1bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the pixel format is 1 bit per pixel and that it uses indexed color. The color table therefore has two colors in it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format4bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 4 bits per pixel, indexed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format8bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 8 bits per pixel, indexed. The color table therefore has 256 colors in it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format16bppGrayScale
member.summary: The pixel format is 16 bits per pixel. The color information specifies 65536 shades of gray.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format16bppRgb555
F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format16bppRgb565
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits are used for the red component, 6 bits are used for the green component, and 5 bits are used for the blue component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format16bppArgb1555
member.summary: The pixel format is 16 bits per pixel. The color information specifies 32,768 shades of color, of which 5 bits are red, 5 bits are green, 5 bits are blue, and 1 bit is alpha.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format24bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The remaining 8 bits are not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppPArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied, according to the alpha component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format48bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format64bppArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format64bppPArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied according to the alpha component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Max
member.summary: The maximum value for this enumeration.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange
member.summary: Specifies a range of character positions within a string.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct, specifying a range of character positions within a string.
member.param: The position of the first character in the range. For example, if First is set to 0, the first position of the range is position 0 in the string.
The number of positions in the range.

member.name: P:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.First
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in the string of the first character of this .

member.name: P:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of positions in this .
member.value: The number of positions in this .

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.op_Equality(Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange,Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange)
member.summary: Compares two objects. Gets a value indicating whether the First and Length values of the two objects are equal.
member.param: A to compare for equality.
A to compare for equality.
member.returns: true to indicate the two CharacterRange objects have the same First and Length values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.op_Inequality(Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange,Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange)
member.summary: Compares two objects. Gets a value indicating whether the First or Length values of the two objects are not equal.
member.param: A to compare for inequality.
A to compare for inequality.
member.returns: true to indicate the either the First or Length values of the two CharacterRange objects differ; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object is equivalent to the specified object.
member.param: The object to compare to for equality..
member.returns: true to indicate the specified object is an instance with the same First and Length value as this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.CharacterRange.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation
member.summary: Determines how the source color in a copy pixel operation is combined with the destination color to result in a final color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NoMirrorBitmap
member.summary: The bitmap is not mirrored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.Blackness
member.summary: The destination area is filled by using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NotSourceErase
member.summary: The source and destination colors are combined using the Boolean OR operator, and then resultant color is then inverted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.NotSourceCopy
member.summary: The inverted source area is copied to the destination.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceErase
member.summary: The inverted colors of the destination area are combined with the colors of the source area using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.DestinationInvert
member.summary: The destination area is inverted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatInvert
member.summary: The colors of the brush currently selected in the destination device context are combined with the colors of the destination are using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceInvert
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceAnd
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.MergePaint
member.summary: The colors of the inverted source area are merged with the colors of the destination area by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.MergeCopy
member.summary: The colors of the source area are merged with the colors of the selected brush of the destination device context using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourceCopy
member.summary: The source area is copied directly to the destination area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.SourcePaint
member.summary: The colors of the source and destination areas are combined using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatCopy
member.summary: The brush currently selected in the destination device context is copied to the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.PatPaint
member.summary: The colors of the brush currently selected in the destination device context are combined with the colors of the inverted source area using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination area using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.Whiteness
member.summary: The destination area is filled by using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. (This color is white for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.CopyPixelOperation.CaptureBlt
member.summary: Windows that are layered on top of your window are included in the resulting image. By default, the image contains only your window. Note that this generally cannot be used for printing device contexts.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.DrawingSettings
member.summary: Allows to adjust the behavior of the drawing library in case of using of some features that are not yet implemented completely.

member.name: P:Aspose.Drawing.DrawingSettings.StrictMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the more strict catching of not implemented features is enabled.
member.remarks: If set to true, in case of using features/parameters that not work correctly in current implementation the library will throw NotImplementedException. If set to false, some parameters may be ignored to give user program chance to work. In that case the drawing results may look different comparing to GDI+.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Font
member.summary: Defines a particular format for text, including font face, size, and style attributes. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.Font.#ctor(Aspose.Drawing.Font,Aspose.Drawing.FontStyle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class uses the specified existing and enumeration..
member.param: The existing from which to create the new .

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor
member.summary: Specifies the known system colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ActiveBorder
member.summary: The system-defined color of the active window's border.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ActiveCaption
member.summary: The system-defined color of the background of the active window's title bar.

member.summary: The system-defined color of the text in the active window's title bar.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.AppWorkspace
member.summary: The system-defined color of the application workspace. The application workspace is the area in a multiple-document view that is not being occupied by documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.Control
member.summary: The system-defined face color of a 3-D element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ControlDark
member.summary: The system-defined shadow color of a 3-D element. The shadow color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ControlDarkDark
member.summary: The system-defined color that is the dark shadow color of a 3-D element. The dark shadow color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the darkest color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ControlLight
member.summary: The system-defined color that is the light color of a 3-D element. The light color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ControlLightLight
member.summary: The system-defined highlight color of a 3-D element. The highlight color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the lightest color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.ControlText
member.summary: The system-defined color of text in a 3-D element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.Desktop
member.summary: The system-defined color of the desktop.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.GrayText
member.summary: The system-defined color of dimmed text. Items in a list that are disabled are displayed in dimmed text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.Highlight
member.summary: The system-defined color of the background of selected items. This includes selected menu items as well as selected text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.HighlightText
member.summary: The system-defined color of the text of selected items.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.KnownColor.HotTrack
member.summary: The system-defined color used to designate a hot-tracked item. Single-clicking a hot-tracked item executes the item.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic"); Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate, in hundredths of an inch, of the hard margin at the left of the page.

member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate, in hundredths of an inch, of the hard margin at the top of the page.
member.returns: The y-coordinate, in hundredths of an inch, of the hard margin at the top of the page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the printer resolution for the page.
member.returns: A that specifies the printer resolution for the page. The default is the printer's default resolution.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.StringAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute
member.summary: The enumeration specifies how to substitute digits in a string according to a user's locale or language.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.User
member.summary: Specifies a user-defined substitution scheme.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.None
member.summary: Specifies to disable substitutions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.National
member.summary: Specifies substitution digits that correspond with the official national language of the user's locale.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.Traditional
member.summary: Specifies substitution digits that correspond with the user's native script or language, which may be different from the official national language of the user's locale.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormat
member.summary: Encapsulates text layout information (such as alignment, orientation and tab stops) display manipulations (such as ellipsis insertion and national digit substitution) and OpenType features. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormat.DigitSubstitutionLanguage
member.summary: Gets the language that is used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
member.returns: A National Language Support (NLS) language identifier that identifies the language that will be used when local digits are substituted for western digits. You can pass the property of a object as the NLS language identifier. For example, suppose you create a object by passing the string "ar-EG" to a constructor. If you pass the property of that object along with. to the method, then Arabic-Indic digits will be substituted for western digits at display time.

member.name: P:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormat.DigitSubstitutionMethod
member.summary: Gets the method to be used for digit substitution.
member.returns: A enumeration value that specifies how to substitute characters in a string that cannot be displayed because they are not supported by the current font.

member.name: M:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormat.SetDigitSubstitution(System.Int32,Aspose.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute)
member.summary: Specifies the language and method to be used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
member.param: A National Language Support (NLS) language identifier that identifies the language that will be used when local digits are substituted for western digits. You can pass the property of a object as the NLS language identifier. For example, suppose you create a object by passing the string "ar-EG" to a constructor. If you pass the property of that object along with to the method, then Arabic-Indic digits will be substituted for western digits at display time.
An element of the enumeration that specifies how digits are displayed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags
member.summary: Specifies the display and layout information for text strings.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.DirectionRightToLeft
member.summary: Text is displayed from right to left.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.DirectionVertical
member.summary: Text is vertically aligned.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.FitBlackBox
member.summary: Parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle. By default, characters are repositioned to avoid any overhang.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.DisplayFormatControl
member.summary: Control characters such as the left-to-right mark are shown in the output with a representative glyph.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.NoFontFallback
member.summary: Fallback to alternate fonts for characters not supported in the requested font is disabled. Any missing characters are displayed with the fonts missing glyph, usually an open square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Includes the trailing space at the end of each line. By default the boundary rectangle returned by the MeasureString method excludes the space at the end of each line. Set this flag to include that space in measurement.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.NoWrap
member.summary: Text wrapping between lines when formatting within a rectangle is disabled. This flag is implied when a point is passed instead of a rectangle, or when the specified rectangle has a zero line length.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.LineLimit
member.summary: Only entire lines are laid out in the formatting rectangle. By default layout continues until the end of the text, or until no more lines are visible as a result of clipping, whichever comes first. Note that the default settings allow the last line to be partially obscured by a formatting rectangle that is not a whole multiple of the line height. To ensure that only whole lines are seen, specify this value and be careful to provide a formatting rectangle at least as tall as the height of one line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.NoClip
member.summary: Overhanging parts of glyphs, and unwrapped text reaching outside the formatting rectangle are allowed to show. By default all text and glyph parts reaching outside the formatting rectangle are clipped.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming
member.summary: Specifies how to trim characters from a string that does not completely fit into a layout shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.None
member.summary: Specifies no trimming.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.Character
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.Word
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.EllipsisCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.EllipsisWord
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.StringTrimming.EllipsisPath
member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Specifies the quality of text rendering.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SystemDefault
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap, with the system default rendering hint. The text will be drawn using whatever font-smoothing settings the user has selected for the system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixelGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is used to improve character appearance on stems and curvature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixel
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.AntiAliasGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap with hinting. Much better quality due to antialiasing, but at a higher performance cost.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.AntiAlias
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap without hinting. Better quality due to antialiasing. Stem width differences may be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

member.name: F:Aspose.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint.ClearTypeGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph ClearType bitmap with hinting. The highest quality setting. Used to take advantage of ClearType font features.
